titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rare Book and Manuscript Leaves Collection, 1400-1932 SC.1970.01
titlestmt.author: Caris Windhausen and Jennifer Needham.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:06:41 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Rare Book and Manuscript Leaves Collection
did.abstract: The Rare Book and Manuscript Leaves Collection is a teaching collection that illustrates the history of the book and printing and includes early examples of printing styles, paper, and enrichments.
did.langmaterial: The material in this collection are in a variety of languages, including Latin, Persian, Greek, German, French, and English.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was a gift to the Elizabeth Nesbitt Room, which was located at the Information Sciences Library, until its closure in 2012. The leaves were gifted to the Nesbitt Room from various donors, namely University of Pittsburgh alumni who purchased the leaves from various booksellers. Some of the leaves include a note identifying the donor and year donated.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in six series according to when each leaf was created or published, and is organized chronologically within each series.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The leaves serve as a teaching collection that illustrates the history of the book and printing due to the variety of printing styles, enrichments, and paper. The collection contains leaves taken from a variety of manuscripts and books, including breviaries, books of hours, antiphonaries, and bibles.

The collection was originally housed at the Elizabeth Nesbitt Room, located at the Information Sciences Library, until its closure in 2012. The leaves were gifted to the Nesbitt Room from various donors, namely University of Pittsburgh alumni who purchased the leaves from various booksellers. Some of the leaves include a note identifying the donor and year donated.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but depending on the date of publications, the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Caris Windhauen, undergraduate student assistant, during the fall of 2016, under the supervision of archivist, Jennifer Needham.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Rare Book and Manuscript Leaves Collection, 1400-1932, SC.1970.01, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rare Book and Manuscript Leaves Collection, 1400-1932, SC.1970.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection contains leaves taken from a variety of manuscripts and books, including breviaries, books of hours, antiphonaries, and bibles. A majority of the collection is from the 14th to 18th century and a number of languages are represented, namely Latin. The collection illustrates the history of the book and printing due to the variety of printing styles, paper, and enrichments, including decorated initials, rubrication, marginalia, handcolored woodblocks, historiated borders, and gothic type and the use of vellum.

did.unittitle: 14th and 15th Century

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: An antiphon for Feast of St. Michael the Archangel.
Characteristics: Manuscript, printed on vellum, red and black ink

did.unittitle: Leaf from a Breviary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Characteristics: Manuscript, two columns, rubrication, red and blue initials, printed on vellum

did.unittitle: Canzoniere e Trionfi, Che fai alma?

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Four different poems from Canzoniere by Petrarch. Printed in Venice, Italy.
Characteristics: Text in Roman typeface, rubricated initials hand written in red and blue, marginalia includes the bishop's hand

did.unittitle: Arom Biblia Latina, Judith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Description of the life of Judith printed by Reynsburch and Novimagio in Venice, Italy.

did.unittitle: Pre-Lutheran Middle High German Bible

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Bible printed in Augsburg, Germany by Anton Sorg.

did.unittitle: Lives of the Saints, Brigitta

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Leaf from Jacobus de Varagine's Lives of the Saints. Printed in Germany.
Characteristics: Gothic typeface, hand colored decorations in red

did.unittitle: Nuremberg Chronicle (Liber Chronicarum),Das furft alter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Bible and history of people related to the Bible printed by H. Schedel. Printed in Germany.
Characteristics: Printed, handcolored woodblocks of Biblical figures, hand colored decorations

did.unittitle: Nuremberg Chronicle (Liber Chronicarum), Sextas etas mudi...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Information on Germanic kings: Henricus Septimus, Wilhelmus, and Conradus. Printed by H. Schedel in Germany.

Language: Latin
Characteristics: Printed, hand decorated initials, woodcuts of Germanic kings of the Interregnum

did.unittitle: Die cronica van der hillger state can coellen, Germany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Leaf printed by Johann Koelhoff (the younger) in Cologne, Germany.
Characteristics: Printed in Gothic typeface, woodcuts, paragraph-marks in red

did.unittitle: Latin prayer book, laudate cum omns...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Characteristics: Manuscript on vellum, illuminations, initials in gold leaf, red and blue ink

did.unittitle: 16th Century
Psalms and liturgical text, in honore tuo...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Printed in Paris, France by Thielmann Kerver
Characteristics: Historiated borders, laid marks, rubrication, wood cuts, cursive type, red and black ink

did.unittitle: Opera, Ducolicou augloga prima

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Virgil's Opera printed by Gruninger in Strausberg

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Printed by Vostre in Paris, France.
Characteristics: historiated borders, printed on vellum

did.unittitle: Flemish Book of Hours, Die ghetijden van onser liever vrouwen met vele schoone loven ende oracien, Rochticheit tenes ende

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Printed by Thielmann Kerver in Paris, France.
Characteristics: Printed, ornamented boarder, rubication, black and red ink

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Printed by Marcolini in Venice, Italy

did.unittitle: Latin Bible, Biblia Sacra Cvm Glossa Interlineari, Ordinaria, Et Nicolai Lyrani Postilla, eiufsdemque Moralitatibus, Burgensis Additionibus, & Thoringl Replicis
17th Century
Greek Book of Religious Works, Vetus Tesamentum Ex Versione Septuaginta Interpretum, De Eleemos Et Collatione In Sanctos Ser XXII

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Book of religious works in Greek with Latin interpretation in right column

did.unittitle: Matthaeu Polo. Synopsis Criticorum Aliorumque Sacrae Scripturae, Commentatorum en EZEC
Matthew Poole. Annotations Upon the Holy Bible, Jeremiah

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Description: Third Edition printed in London

did.unittitle: 18th Century
Leaf from a Farsi text

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Quote from Orientalia: "Illuminated leaf from an Eighteenth Century Persian manuscript of poems."

did.unittitle: Cornelius A Lapide. E Societate Jesu, S. Scipturae Olim Lovanii, Postea Romae Professoris, Commentarius in Canticum Canticorum, Commentaria in Matthaum

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Comments on scriptures, law and prophets.

did.unittitle: Augustin Calmet.Commentarium Literale In Omnees Ac Singulos Tum Veteris…

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A page of comments on the Bible and Biblical law printed by Sebastiano Coleti

did.unittitle: Samuel Ecclesiastes, in Cathedram Productus, Pro S. Benedicti Panegyrico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Description: Original book from a monastary in Budapest, Hungary that was confiscated with other religious books.

did.unittitle: Rapin de Thoyras.The History of England
Joseph Ignaz Claus. Spicilegium Catechetico-Concionatorium id est Conceptus Exegetici, De Judicio Circa Opera Bon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Critical religious explainations on the Bible and other Catholic texts.

did.unittitle: Francois-Aime Pouget. Institutiones Catholicae in Modum Catecheseos…

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Details the history and institutions of Catholicism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Facsimile of a broadside printed in Washington D.C. with commentary by James Gilreath.

did.unittitle: Joanne Baptiste Conet. Clypeus Theologiae Thomisticaue, Quaft VIII De Ordine Charitatis inter proximos
Sheet of printer ornaments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Sample of various printers ornamentations including vignettes; head-pieces; tail-pieces; alphabet in roman and italic type. Printed in France.

did.unittitle: 19th Century

unittitle.title: The Famous History Of the Learned Friar Bacon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Page from the biography of Friar Roger Bacon. Printed in Bow-Church-Yard, London, England.

did.unittitle: Declaration of Independence reprint from Harper's Weekly

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A reprint of the Declaration of Independence from Harper's Weekly, July 3, 1858. Printed in New York, USA.

did.unittitle: 20th Century
JM Barrie. Farewell Miss Julie Logan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: J.M. Barrie's final work of prose, published as a free supplement to The Times on Thursday December 24, 1931.

did.unittitle: Gutenberg Bible Facsimile, Gutenberg and the Book of Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A reproduction of Psalm 23 from the Gutenberg Bible printed by William Edwin Rudge, New York 1932.
Characteristics: Initials in blue and red ink

did.unittitle: Le Journal de la Decoration, Motifs du Moyen-Age

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A collection of illustrations by Willy Pogany. Printed in France.
